metatags.og:description: The Pineda family trudged northward for more than a month with a caravan of Central American migrants who are now stuck at the U.S. border. But they were on the run in Honduras much longer than that due to fears of political persecution.

imageobject.caption: A Honduran migrant couple and their five kids, who are participating in a caravan heading to the US, wait to cross the border from Ciudad Tecun Uman in Guatemala, to Ciudad Hidalgo, Mexico,...
A migrant takes shelter from the relentless sun in Ciudad Hidalgo’s Parque Central, October 20, 2018.
A migrant holds up the flag of Honduras in Ciudad Hidalgo’s Parque Central, October 20, 2018.
A group of migrants take a dip in the Suchiate River, which separates Guatemala and Mexico, October 20, 2018.
A group of migrants travels across the Suchiate River from Guatemala to Mexico aboard a raft made of wooden planks and tractor tire inner tubes, October 20, 2018.
People build an impromptu shelter on the Guatemalan side of the bridge connecting to Mexico, Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
A Honduran man waits patiently for news in front of the shuttered crossing between Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
A woman waves her US Green Card as she explains life in the United States as a migrant, Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
A man smiles as he leans against the gate that separates Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
Mexican troops and police stand guard behind the gate separating Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
A Honduran man stands before the locked gate at the crossing between Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
Mexican troops and police stand guard behind the gate separating Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
Groups of migrants settle in for another night on the bridge between Mexico and Tecun Uman, Guatemala, hoping to be allowed entry the next morning, October 20, 2018.
Guatemalan officials spray for mosquitos as night descends on Tecun Uman, Guatemala, October 20, 2018.
A crowd of Central American migrants stretches over a mile long as they march from Ciudad Hidalgo to Tapachula, Mexico, October 21, 2018.
Men and women link arms as they prepare to start walking after a short break on the highway from Ciudad Hidalgo to Tapachula, Mexico, October 21, 2018.
A family holds hands as they walk in 80 degree weather on the highway from Ciudad Hidalgo to Tapachula, Mexico, October 21, 2018.
